com.box.androidlib.ResponseListeners
Interface FileDownloadListener

All Superinterfaces:
ResponseListener
public interface FileDownloadListener
extends ResponseListener

Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when Box.download() is called.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String STATUS_DOWNLOAD_FAIL
          download status to indicate that the download failed for unknown reason.
static java.lang.String STATUS_DOWNLOAD_OK
          download status to indicate successful download with no errors.
static java.lang.String STATUS_DOWNLOAD_PERMISSIONS_ERROR
          download status to indicate that the user did not have permissions to download the file.
static java.lang.String STATUS_DOWNLOAD_RESTRICTED
          download status to indicate that the API key was invalid.
static java.lang.String STATUS_DOWNLOAD_WRONG_AUTH_TOKEN
          download status to indicate that the download failed because the auth token was invalid.
 
Fields inherited from interface com.box.androidlib.ResponseListeners.ResponseListener
STATUS_APPLICATION_RESTRICTED, STATUS_NOT_LOGGED_IN, STATUS_UNKNOWN_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE

Method Detail

onComplete

void onComplete(java.lang.String status)
Called when the file has been downloaded. Note: even if a file is downloaded, you must still check if the file itself contains an error code instead of the expected file contents. Refer to http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and-Download for details.

Parameters:
status - This will be 'download_ok' if the file has been download.

onProgress

void onProgress(long bytesDownloaded)
Called periodically during the download. You can use this to monitor download progress.

Parameters:
bytesDownloaded - The number of bytes that have been downloaded so far. Note that this will eventually slightly exceed the size of the file being download because of overhead of HTTP requests (e.g. HTTP headers)
